```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(lubridate)
library(plotly)
library(ggplot2)
library(RNRCS)

```

## Pulling in data


```{r processing data}
## pull in jw hourly met
jw_hr <- read.table(
  "C:/Users/sears/Documents/Research/CPF/Data_downloads/joewright_met_hr_20220227.dat",
  sep = ",", header=TRUE, skip="1") %>%
  slice(., -(1:2)) %>%
  mutate(TIMESTAMP = ymd_hms(TIMESTAMP)) %>%
  mutate_if(is.character,as.numeric) %>%
  mutate(site = 'jw')

## pull in tc hourly met
tc_hr <- read.table(
  "C:/Users/sears/Documents/Research/CPF/Data_downloads/tunnelcreek_met2_hr_20220227.dat",
  sep = ",", header=TRUE, skip="1")%>%
  slice(., -(1:2)) %>%
  mutate(TIMESTAMP = ymd_hms(TIMESTAMP)) %>%
  mutate_if(is.character,as.numeric) %>%
  mutate(site = 'tc')

## pull in mc hourly met
mc_hr <- read.csv("C:/Users/sears/Documents/Research/CPF/Data_downloads/mtncampus_20220223.csv") %>%
  mutate(TIMESTAMP = ymd_hm(TIMESTAMP)) %>%
  mutate(hour = hour(TIMESTAMP),
         yday = yday(TIMESTAMP)) %>%
  group_by(yday, hour) %>%
  summarize_all(list(mean)) %>%
  mutate(TIMESTAMP = floor_date(TIMESTAMP, "hour")) %>%
  mutate(site = 'mc')
```

##  Binding data together

```{r getting one df, echo=T}
## compare incoming SW between sites, put in 1 df
mc_tc <- bind_rows(mc_hr, tc_hr)

#bind all 3, then keep only rad data, filter to start on Nov1
mc_tc_jw <- bind_rows(mc_tc, jw_hr) %>%
  select(c(TIMESTAMP, SWin_Avg, SWout_Avg, 
           LWin_Avg, LWout_Avg,
           SWalbedo_Avg, site)) %>%
  filter(TIMESTAMP > ymd_hms("2021-11-01 00:00:00"))

```
## Incoming shorwave rad

```{r}
## plot SW in 1 plot
swin <- ggplot(mc_tc_jw, aes(x = TIMESTAMP, y= SWin_Avg, color = site)) +
  geom_line(size=1) +
  ggtitle("SWin")

swin

ggplotly(swin)

```

## Outgoing shortwave rad

```{r}
## SW out as one plot
swout <- ggplot(mc_tc_jw, aes(x = TIMESTAMP, y= SWout_Avg, color = site)) +
  geom_line(size=1) +
  ggtitle("SWout")

swout

ggplotly(swout)

```

## Albedo

```{r}
## plot albebo in 1 plot but limit the y vals
al <- ggplot(mc_tc_jw, aes(x = TIMESTAMP, y= SWalbedo_Avg, color = site)) +
  geom_line(size=1) +
  ylim(0,1) +
  ggtitle("Albedo")

al

ggplotly(al)

```

## Net shortwave (computing SWin - SWout)

```{r}
swnet <- ggplot(mc_tc_jw, aes(x = TIMESTAMP, y= SWin_Avg-SWout_Avg, color=site)) +
  geom_line(size=1) +
  ggtitle("SWnet")

swnet

ggplotly(swnet)
```
